meanings.sent1: The substructure of the house provides stability.
meanings.sent2: The engineer inspected the substructure of the bridge.
meanings.sent3: The ants built their substructure with tiny pebbles.
meanings.sent4: Her love for him was the substructure of her happiness.
meanings.sent5: The substructure of the tree was hidden beneath the ground.

meanings.definition: A supporting structure beneath a building or other construction.
meanings.sent1: The substructure of the tower held it upright.
meanings.sent2: The workers reinforced the substructure of the dam.
meanings.sent3: The substructure of the sandcastle was stronger than expected.
meanings.sent4: The substructure of the team was their unwavering unity.
meanings.sent5: The substructure of the ship was crucial for its seaworthiness.

meanings.definition: The basic framework or foundation of something.
meanings.sent1: The substructure of the argument was flawed.
meanings.sent2: The substructure of the theory needed further research.
meanings.sent3: The substructure of the cake was the delicious sponge.
meanings.sent4: Trust forms the substructure of any relationship.
meanings.sent5: The substructure of the plan was carefully laid out.
